author: finanzen.net
title: Analysis: Gold set for further record prices in 2024 and 2025 | finanzen.net
text:
Analysis: Gold set for further record prices in 2024 and 2025 28.12.23 17:29 Uhr Werbung Werte in diesem Artikel Rohstoffe Goldpreis 2.069,44 USD 3,91 USD 0,19% News Gold prices have been setting annual records for the past three years. They are expected to set further records in 2024 and 2025, as the world struggles with a host of domestic and international political issues, a likely slowdown if not outright recession in the United States and some other developed countries, and various other economic and financial market challenges. Gold had been in a cyclical low consolidation phase from April 2013 until June 2019, trading between US$1,200 and US$1,350 per oz. for most of that period. But prices have been on the rise since then. They rose to a record average of US$1,775.58 in 2020, up 37.2% from the annual average price the previous year. After that, there were incremental increases over the next three years. In 2021, gold averaged US$1,799.32, rising to an average of $1,804.36 last year. This year through October, the price averaged US$1,940 per oz., up 7.4%. Jeffrey M. ChristianThat compares to a daily record US$2,058.40 per oz. on a daily settlement price basis in 2020. This year gold touched US$2,152.30 on an intraday basis on Dec. 3, after reaching a new record high settlement price US$2,089.70 on Dec. 1. For the full year 2023, CPM Group projects an average price of US$1,950 or higher, with prices likely to end the year above US$2,000 per ounce. CPM expects gold prices to average well above US$2,000 in 2024 and probably above US$2,100 per oz. in 2025. In the face of four consecutive years of record gold prices, it is strange that so many gold market investors, mining executives, and observers have continually wondered aloud why gold prices are so low. Clearly it is not a matter of gold prices being too low but rather that these folks have too great expectations for gold prices. Gold prices reflect (a) supply and demand fundamentals and realities, (b) the increasingly hostile political world, and (c) the state of the global economy, which has backed away some from severely gloomy expectations but still is shrouded in economic and financial system issues that could combine with those political risks to trigger severe economic, political, and social conditions. Each of these three sectors interact to determine the directions and levels of all commodity prices, including gold. Each warrants sober, unbiased analyses. The fundamentals still apply Mine production, secondary recovery of gold from scrap, fabrication demand, central bank buying and selling, and investment demand all influence gold prices. Of these, the most dynamic, the best financed, the most volatile and unpredictable sector is investment demand, and it has the most influence on gold prices. Investors bought on a net, collective basis, 16 million oz. of physical gold in 2018 and 17 million oz. in 2019. These are relatively low volumes of net investment demand, and this was reflected in the gold price. By July 2019, the economic and political environments were darkening and investors stepped up their gold buying. Then 2020 came, bringing with it the COVID-19 pandemic and global lockdown, an engineered deep recession globally, and massive government financial support programs around the world. In this environment, investors bought 40 million oz. of gold, close to their historically highest levels of net investment demand. This was in fact the fourth largest annual net investment buying spree in history, supporting strong gold prices. Over the next three years economic and political conditions remained difficult, even with the turbo-charged recovery in 2021 as the vaccines circulated, economies opened up, and stimulus money was spent. In this environment, investors were net buyers of 24-27 million oz. of gold bullion per year. This was strong enough to keep prices above US$1,625 per oz. for most of this period, but it was not the 40 million oz. of demand that had fuelled the 37% increase in annual gold prices in 2020. That said, it also was not the 16-17 million oz. annual levels that kept prices below US$1,350 per oz. in 2018 and the first half of 2019. Net investment demand is projected to top 30 million oz. next year, possibly approaching 40 million oz. in 2025. Such levels of demand would be fuelled by a combination of corrosive political and economic developments. Unlike in the period 2007-2011, CPM expects political concerns to play a more decisive role over the next two years than will economic conditions. But economic conditions and financial market instabilities certainly are expected to weigh on investorsâ€™ minds, helping convince them to buy historically large volumes of physical gold even at record high prices. Hand in glove with investors stocking up on gold will be central bank buying. Central banks have been buying around 10 million oz. per year on average since around 2009. They bought around 10.2 million oz. in 2022 and are on pace to buy around 13 million oz. this year. They should be expected to continue buying large volumes of gold for more than the next decade, but they may back off slightly over the next two years. (CPM projects gold supply, demand, investment demand, official transactions, and prices out 10 years.) Any dip in central bank buying over the next two years will be price related. As opposed to private sector investors who will chase prices higher, buying more metal as prices rise, central banks are much more price sensitive. They are value investors who prefer to buy during periods of less intense private investor demand. Thus, central banks were large buyers of around 17 million oz. per year in 2018 and 2019, but bought less than half of that when prices rose sharply in 2020. One example is the Peopleâ€™s Bank of China, perhaps the largest volume buyer in the past decade. It was regularly buying gold for its monetary reserves from domestic refined production through the first half of 2019. When gold prices shot up in July 2019, they stopped adding gold to their reserves. They only resumed buying in November 2022, once gold had fallen from US$2,043 per oz. earlier that year to US$1,623. Since then, the PBOC has bought more than 8 million oz. of gold from domestic sources. Strange theories While central banks as a group have been steadily adding gold to their monetary reserves, there has been an enormous explosion of strange comments and theories about what central banks plan to do with gold. There are no plans for the emerging BRICS group (including Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa) to establish a gold-based trading currency. (While Vladimir Putin has spoken of this, the governments and central banks of the BRICS countries have made it clear they have no interest in any such arrangements.) There are no plans to recall circulating currencies. The idea of returning to some sort of gold standard circulates only in the minds of people nostalgic for a stable economic past that in fact never existed. Central bankers and mainstream economists uniformly know that past gold standards led to massive economic problems, including repeated depressions, periods of super high inflation , and worse. They know that every past gold standard ended in disaster. None of this empirical evidence dissuades believers in magical gold standards. After all, to stop believing something because real-world evidence shows your beliefs are misplaced is blasphemy, a breach of faith. Such talk is an aside. Meanwhile, central banks seek to diversify their monetary reserves, with 60% of their foreign exchange holdings in U.S. dollars. The small relative size of the gold market limits the extent to which gold can diversify these holdings, while the relative lack of liquidity and much higher volatility of gold limit central banksâ€™ interest in the metal. Stock demand â€“ the purchases of gold for addition to gold bullion holdings by either investors or central banks â€“ is the key driver of gold prices. Fabrication demand and supply are important factors, but less dynamic. Mine production for its part has stabilized over the past three years, after three years of declining output. Mine output appears likely to be relatively flat in 2024 compared to the 87.6 million oz. projected for 2023. Beyond next year mine production is expected to resume its decline for several years. Secondary supply is projected to rise sharply from 34.8 million oz. in 2023 over the next two years, as significantly higher record prices stimulate jewelry owners to sell old, broken, and unwanted pieces for gold. Beyond 2025 such sales would be expected to decline once more, assuming CPMâ€™s longer-term projections of lower prices in later years proves accurate. Fabrication demand is projected to reach 92.6 million oz. this year. Most of this, around 77 million oz., went into jewelry and decorative objects. Gold is also used in electronics, chemicals, dental and medical applications, and other fabricated products. While some people reasonably expected the higher gold bullion prices would lead to reductions of gold jewelry sales, gold prices are only one factor that influences jewelry demand. Jewellers work hard to preserve the â€˜price pointsâ€™ or affordability of jewelry pieces, reducing the gold content per piece as prices rise. Jewelry demand also is heavily influenced by wealth factors, and the relative liquidity of many consumers due to the government stimuli programs of 2020 have keep jewelry demand buoyant over the past three years. That may dissipate over the next two years, however. Putting all of this together into a gold price outlook, it appears likely that the plethora of political, economic, financial, and social problems will continue to stimulate investor demand over the next couple of years, with additional demand from monetary authorities. This demand is likely to push gold prices higher, setting further records over the next two years, or until things improve. In the meantime, buckle up. Jeffrey M. Christian is managing partner with CPM Group. Weiter zum vollstÃ¤ndigen Artikel bei Mining.com Zum vollstÃ¤ndigen Artikel Quelle: Mining.com
Nachrichten zu Goldpreis

author: Solomon Thompson
title: Nvidia’s GeForce RTX 5090 Possible Price Revealed
text:
According to a new report, the GeForce RTX 5090 GPU will be very expensive. It is said to be priced at $1,999 in the US. This isn’t the first time that the potential price of NVIDIA ‘s new high-end graphics solution has been leaked, but as the announcement date approaches, which should take place at CES 2025, according to rumors (thanks Notebookcheck ), it is inevitable that the information will multiply.
Price Comparison with Previous Generations Damn, the GeForce RTX 5090 will cost ~1900 Dollar.
— Bits And Chips – Eng (@BitsAndChipsEng) November 18, 2024 If the rumor turns out to be accurate, that would be $300 more than the RTX 4090 was launched at, and it would continue NVIDIA’s trend of significantly increasing prices with each generation. The sources that revealed the price are Chinese and Japanese journalists, who in reality do not completely agree, since they gave two possibilities: $1,899 and $1,999, with the latter prevailing.
According to Bits And Chips, the overclocked version will surpass the $2,000 mark. The Asus TUF Gaming GeForce RTX 4090 OG OC Edition currently costs $1,819.95 on Amazon.
Speculation on Hardware Upgrades According to other rumors, Nvidia is about to launch the GeForce RTX 5090 with a GB203 GPU paired with 32GB of GDDR7 VRAM on a 512-bit memory bus. Additionally, Nvidia is said to have adopted a new 12V-2×6 power connector, replacing the 12VHPWR after just one generation. As always, all this information should be taken with a grain of salt, although NVIDIA is known to be somewhat tight-lipped about its upcoming products.

author: @record_mexico
title: Tom Brady anuncia la muerte de su perro Lua, que adoptó con su exesposa Gisele Bundchen
text: Tom Brady anuncia la muerte de su perro Lua, que adoptó con su exesposa Gisele Bundchen El legendario quarterback de la [NFL](https://www.record.com.mx/empelotados), [Tom Brady](https://www.record.com.mx/empelotados) [,](https://www.record.com.mx/empelotados) compartió una noticia el sábado por la tarde a través de su cuenta de Instagram. Informó el fallecimiento de Lua, su perro mascota, dos días antes de la Navidad. Brady, dedicó un emotivo tributo a Lua, acompañado de fotografías de sus hijos abrazando a la mascota. En su publicación, comentó: "Te amamos Lua", y añadió en otro mensaje, "'Por siempre en nuestros corazones'." La exesposa del mariscal de campo, la supermodelo [Gisele Bundchen](https://www.record.com.mx/empelotados), también compartió un sentido homenaje en su historia de Instagram. En una publicación, Bundchen honró a Lua como su "pequeña Lulu". "Nuestra pequeña Lulu, nuestro ángel guardián se fue al cielo. Ella vivirá por siempre en nuestros corazones", expresó la modelo. De acuerdo con reportes Tom Brady habría adoptado a la mascota junto con su exesposa cuando aún estaban juntos. [TAMBIÉN TE PUEDE INTERESAR: KENTI ROBLES PROTAGONIZÓ POSTAL NAVIDEÑA A LADO DE CARLO ANCELOTTI Y LUKA MODRIC](https://www.record.com.mx/empelotados/kenti-robles-protagonizo-postal-navidena-a-lado-de-carlo-ancelotti-y-luka-modric)

author: Liz Basaldúa
title: ¡Namasté! 7 lugares para practicar yoga en CDMX
text:
¡Namasté! 7 lugares para practicar yoga en CDMX
Sé un chilango feliz, encuentra tu equilibrio y paz interior este 2024 con nuestra selección de los 7 lugares para practicar yoga en CDMX.
Por: Liz Basaldúa
¿Listo para recibir el 2024 con una mente clara y un cuerpo revitalizado? Si uno de tus propósitos es encontrar armonía y bienestar, practicar yoga puede ser tu mejor aliado. La Ciudad de México, con su vibrante energía y espacios tranquilos, ofrece opciones perfectas para todos, desde yoguis experimentados hasta principiantes. Aquí te presentamos 7 lugares para practicar yoga en la CDMX, ¡despliega tu tapete y entra en el mood más zen!
- Yoga Loft
Aquí vas a encontrar un oasis de calma perfecto para tus clases de yoga. Ofrecen de todo, desde rocket yoga y Dharma hasta Restaurativo. Pero la estrella del lugar es su Aero Yoga. ¿Te imaginas hacer yoga suspendido en un trapecio o en un columpio de tela? Esa es la magia del Aero Yoga: te permite explorar posturas nuevas y sorprendentes, flotando en el aire. Es una experiencia genial para alinear tu espalda y darle un merecido descanso a tus músculos. Definitivamente, Yoga Loft te lleva a otro nivel de relajación y bienestar.
Lugar: Tabasco 152. Col. Roma Norte
Horario: Hay clases todos los días de la semana desde las 7:00
Costo: Clases desde $300
- Da Yoga
En Da Yoga, encontrarás un abanico de clases adaptadas a distintas necesidades y gustos. Desde el relajante Yoga Somático, que calma el sistema nervioso, hasta el dinámico Vinyasa Somático, perfecto para mejorar la consciencia corporal y la flexibilidad. Si buscas una experiencia más introspectiva, el Movimiento Somático te invita a explorar la conexión entre cuerpo, mente y emociones. Para los amantes de la estructura, el Ashtanga Yoga ofrece una secuencia constante de posturas, creciendo en complejidad con tu práctica. Y para un equilibrio entre cuerpo y espíritu, el Hatha Yoga integra posturas físicas, respiración y meditación, proporcionando una experiencia de yoga completa y enriquecedora.
Lugar: Heriberto Frías 563. Col. Narvarte
Horario: De lunes a sábado desde las 7:00
Costo: Clases desde $180
- Mukta Yoga
En Mukta Yoga, una escuela con 22 años de trayectoria, encontrarás el lugar perfecto si tu sueño es convertirte en instructor de yoga. Ofrecen especializaciones en Anatomía Funcional y Biomecánica, Yoga Especializado y Fundamentos de Yoga Terapéutico. ¿Quieres compartir el yoga con los más pequeños? Tienen cursos especialmente diseñados para niños. Pero lo que realmente destaca en Mukta Yoga son sus clases únicas de yoga con música en vivo, que crean una atmósfera mágica; y sus sesiones de Vinyasa Flow, ideales para fluir al ritmo de la música y conectar profundamente con tu práctica. ¡Una experiencia que te llenará de energía y paz interior!
Lugar: Ámsterdam 171. Col. Condesa
Horario: Hay clases todos los días de la semana desde las 6:00
Costo: Desde $400
- Tetetlán Consciencia
El Centro de Consciencia Corporal Tetetlán es un oasis para quienes buscan equilibrio y bienestar. Ofrecen una amplia gama de actividades, desde yoga y meditación hasta Box, Zhi Neg Qui Gon y Body Fitness Pilates. Aquí también puedes profundizar en la filosofía del yoga y explorar formaciones mentales samskara y Hatla lunar. Pero lo que realmente hace especial a Tetetlán es su entorno, un espacio físico diseñado para fomentar la conexión contigo mismo y con tu paz interior. Ya sea que busques fortalecer tu cuerpo, calmar tu mente o expandir tu consciencia, Tetetlán tiene algo para ti, en un ambiente que promueve la serenidad y el autodescubrimiento. ¡Simplemente increíble!
Lugar: Av. De las Fuentes 180. Col. Bosques del Pedregal
Horario: De lunes a sábado desde las 7:00
Costo: Clase suelta $250
- Sukhavati Yoga
En Sukhavati Yoga, encontrarás una experiencia integral de yoga. Ofrecen clases para todos los niveles, abarcando estilos como Hatha, Vinyasa, y Yoga Dance, además de cursos teóricos y certificaciones de maestro. ¿Buscas algo más que yoga? Prueba sus clases de Barre o calistenia. Abiertos todos los días, con horarios matutinos y vespertinos, Sukhavati se adapta a tu ritmo de vida. Con precios desde $899 mensuales, es una excelente opción para sumergirte en el mundo del yoga en 2024
Lugar: Belisario Domínguez 169. Col. Del Carmen Coyoacán
Horario: De lunes a domingo desde las 7:00
Costo: Clase suelta desde $300
- Lila Yoga Studio
En Lila Yoga Studio, cada clase es una oportunidad para descubrir el equilibrio y la armonía. Con opciones como Morning Yoga Flow y Ashtanga Yoga, este estudio se caracteriza por su ambiente honesto y creativo. Sus profesionales apasionados del movimiento te guiarán de manera segura y divertida, ofreciendo también clases personalizadas para adaptarse a tus necesidades. Aquí, la inclusión y la libertad son la norma, haciendo que todos se sientan bienvenidos en un espacio donde se celebra la diversidad y la autoexpresión. ¡Lila Yoga Studio es más que un lugar para practicar yoga; es una comunidad donde puedes ser tú mismo!
Lugar: Río Nazas 65. Col. Cuauhtémoc.
Horario: De lunes a sábado desde las 7:00
Costo: Clase suelta desde $250
- Con Pausa
Con Pausa es un oasis de bienestar en la ciudad, donde puedes encontrar desde clases de yoga y pilates hasta crossfit y baile de salón, pasando por un relajante spa y masajes rejuvenecedores. Este espacio único está diseñado para expandir tu energía y brindarte una profunda sensación de paz. Comienza el nuevo año con una revitalizante sesión de saludo al sol, descubre la flexibilidad de tu cuerpo y la expansión de tu alma. ¡Prepárate para un año lleno de energía y serenidad!
Lugar: Colima 159. Col. Roma Norte
Horario: De lunes a sábado desde las 7:00
Costo: Clase suelta desde $250
Estos lugares de yoga no solo te ofrecen la oportunidad de mejorar tu flexibilidad y fortaleza física, sino también de encontrar un refugio de paz y serenidad en tu día a día. Respira profundo y prepárate para recibir el 2024 con el alma en paz. ¡Namasté, chilangos felices!
Te puede interesar:
Checa tus nuevas obligaciones si tienes mascotas o animales de compañía en CDMX

author: Staff reports
title: Minnesota state parks offering guided hikes on New Year's Day
text:
Minnesota state parks offering guided hikes on New Year’s Day
The hikes are being held at 10 state parks as part of a nationwide effort to connect people with the outdoors, according to the Minnesota Department of Natural Resources
ST. PAUL — Several Minnesota state parks are hosting guided "First Day Hikes" on New Year's Day, Wednesday.
The First Day Hike is described as a winter walk offering a new perspective on the landscape — slower and quieter, but with much to experience.
ADVERTISEMENT
The hikes are being held at 10 state parks as part of a nationwide effort to connect people with the outdoors, according to a news release from the Minnesota Department of Natural Resources. In an initiative spearheaded by America’s State Parks, hikers in all 50 states will welcome the new year with an outdoor hike, exercising and connecting with nature.
Minnesota’s First Day Hikes will be held at Blue Mounds, Fort Snelling, Jay Cooke, Lake Bemidji, Maplewood, Minneopa, Nerstrand-Big Woods, Sibley, Whitewater and Wild River state parks. There is no participation fee, but some of the hikes require advance registration.
For more information, visit the DNR's First Day Hikes webpage at
[mndnr.gov/firstdayhike.](http://mndnr.gov/firstdayhike)
